Distributions¶

Cosmos Distributions¶

For details on the Pyro distribution interface, see

class cosmos.distributions.AffineBeta(mean, size, loc, scale, validate_args=None)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.torch.TransformedDistribution

Beta distribution shifted by loc and scaled by scale:

concentration1 = size * (mean - loc) / scale
concentration0 = size * (loc - mean) / scale
X ~ Beta(concentration1, concentration0)
f(X) = loc + scale * X
Y = f(X) ~ AffineBeta(mean, size, loc, scale)
Parameters

  • mean – mean of the distribution.

  • size – size parameter of the Beta distribution.

  • loc – loc parameter.

  • scale – scale parameter.

has_rsample = True¶
expand(batch_shape, _instance=None)[source]¶
sample(sample_shape=torch.Size([]))[source]¶

Generates a sample from Beta distribution and applies AffineTransform. Additionally clamps the output in order to avoid NaN and Inf values in the gradients.

rsample(sample_shape=torch.Size([]))[source]¶

Generates a sample from Beta distribution and applies AffineTransform. Additionally clamps the output in order to avoid NaN and Inf values in the gradients.

property loc¶
property scale¶
property mean¶

Returns the mean of the distribution.

class cosmos.distributions.ConvolutedGamma(concentration, rate, samples, log_weights)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.torch_distribution.TorchDistribution

Sum of the offset variable and the Gamma distributed variable:

X ~ P(samples, log_weights)
Y ~ Gamma(concentration, rate)
Z = X + Y ~ OffsetedGamma(convolution, rate, samples, log_weights)

log_prob() is calculated as the convolution of the offset probability and the Gamma distribution:

\(p(X) = \sum_i p(\text{offset}_i) \text{Gamma}(X - \text{offset}_i)\)

Parameters

  • concentration – shape parameter (alpha) of the Gamma distribution.

  • rate – rate parameter (beta) of the Gamma distribution.

  • samples (Tensor) – offset samples.

  • log_weights (Tensor) – log weights corresponding to the offset samples.

arg_constraints = {'concentration': GreaterThan(lower_bound=0.0), 'rate': GreaterThan(lower_bound=0.0)}¶
log_prob(value)[source]¶

Returns the log of the probability density/mass function evaluated at value.

Args:

value (Tensor):

class cosmos.distributions.ConvolutedNormal(loc, scale, samples, log_weights)[source]¶

Bases: pyro.distributions.torch_distribution.TorchDistribution

Sum of the offset variable and the Normal distributed variable:

X ~ P(samples, log_weights)
Y ~ Normal(loc, scale)
Z = X + Y ~ OffsetedNormal(loc, scale, samples, log_weights)

log_prob() is calculated as the convolution of the offset probability and the Normal distribution:

\(p(X) = \sum_i p(\text{offset}_i) \text{Normal}(X - \text{offset}_i)\)

Parameters

  • loc – loc parameter of the Normal distribution.

  • scale – scale parameter of the Normal distribution.

  • samples (Tensor) – offset samples.

  • log_weights (Tensor) – log weights corresponding to the offset samples.

arg_constraints = {}¶
log_prob(value)[source]¶

Returns the log of the probability density/mass function evaluated at value.

Args:

value (Tensor):
